All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AccountType
Enumeration representing different types of user accounts.
Book
The Book class represents a book product.
Buyer
The Buyer class represents a buyer user.
BuyerMenu
The BuyerMenu class represents the menu interface for a buyer in the online shopping system.
Cart
The Cart class represents a shopping cart containing items.
CartItem
Represents an item in a shopping cart.
CartItemMenu
The CartItemMenu class represents a submenu specifically designed for managing a single cart item.
CartItemPage
The CartItemPage class represents a page that displays details of a single item in the user's shopping cart.
CheckoutMenu
The CheckoutMenu class represents a menu specifically designed for handling the checkout process and finalizing orders within the online shopping system.
CheckoutPrompt
The CheckoutPrompt class provides a utility for creating a prompt to gather checkout-related information.
Command
An interface representing a command to be executed.
ComputerHardware
Represents a computer hardware product.
ContainerConfig
Configuration class for setting up the IoC container.
EmailValidator
A validator for checking the validity of email addresses.
FollowedMenu
The FollowedMenu class represents a menu for displaying and interacting with followed users by the current buyer.
GuestMenu
The GuestMenu class represents the menu interface for guest users in the online shopping system.
IntegerValidator
A validator for checking the validity of an integer.
IoCContainer
A IoC container that manages different types of instances.
Issue
Represents an issue associated to an order.
IssueMenu
The IssueMenu class represents a menu for managing issues related to orders.
IssuePage
The IssuePage class represents the page displaying information about an issue related to an order.
IssueState
Enumeration representing different states of an issue.
JSONHandler
A utility class for handling, reading and writing JSON data.
LearningResource
Represents a learning resource product.
LoginPrompt
The LoginPrompt class creates a login prompt with username and password components
Main
 
MainMenu
The MainMenu class represents the main menu of the application for user authentication and navigation.
Menu
Represents a menu that contains various menu components.
MenuComponent
Represents a component of a menu.
MenuContainer
Represents a container for menu components.
MenuItem
Represents a menu item that is associated with a command.
MetricsMenu
 
MetricsOptionsMenu
A menu to manage and display various metrics for a user.
MetricsPage
The MetricsPage class represents the metrics page of the current user.
NotificationsMenu
The NotificationsMenu class generates a menu displaying notifications for the current user.
OfficeEquipment
Represents an office equipment product.
Order
Represents an order placed by a buyer for one or more products.
OrderController
Controller class managing operations related to orders.
OrderItemMenu
The OrderItemMenu class represents a menu for managing individual orders within the online shopping system.
OrderPage
The OrderPage class represents a page displaying details of a specific order.
OrderService
Service class for handling order-related operations.
OrdersMenu
The OrdersMenu class generates a menu displaying a list of orders for the current user.
OrderState
Enumeration representing different states of an order.
PasswordValidator
A validator for checking the validity of a password.
PhoneValidator
A validator for checking the validity of a phone number.
PointsPrompt
The PointsPrompt class is responsible for creating a prompt related to points.
PointsValidator
 
PriceValidator
A validator for checking the validity of a price.
Product
 
ProductCatalog
The ProductCatalog class represents a catalog of products, providing functionality to display and filter products based on different search criteria.
ProductController
Controller class managing operations related to products.
ProductList<T extends Product>
A generic list of products extending the Product class.
ProductMenu
The ProductMenu class represents a menu for managing product-related actions.
ProductPage
The ProductPage class represents a page displaying detailed information about a specific product.
ProductPrompt
The ProductPrompt class provides a method to create prompts for capturing product information based on the product type.
ProductRepository
The ProductRepository class is responsible for managing and persisting products.
ProductService
Service class for handling product-related operations.
ProductType
Enumerations representing different types of product.
PromotionPrompt
The PromotionPrompt class provides a method to create a prompt for setting promotion information.
Prompt
Represents a prompt container containing various prompt components.
PromptItem
Represents a prompt item that includes a prompt message and a validator for user input.
QuantityPrompt
The QuantityPrompt class provides a method to create a prompt for collecting quantity information.
RatingValidator
A validator for checking the validity of a rating.
RegisterPrompt
Represents a prompt for user registration providing components for various user details on the account type.
ReportPrompt
The ReportPrompt class creates a prompt for reporting issues or problems.
ReturnMenu
The ReturnMenu class generates a menu for return or exchange of items in an order for a buyer.
ReturnPrompt
Represents a prompt generator specifically designed for handling return reasons in exchange operations.
Review
 
ReviewMenu
The ReviewMenu class represents a menu for managing reviews on a product.
ReviewPrompt
The ReviewPrompt class provides a method to create a prompt for collecting user reviews.
SearchMenu
The SearchMenu class generates a menu for performing various searches within the application.
SearchPrompt
The SearchPrompt class generates prompt components based on the specified search type.
SearchType
Enumeration representing the types of search.
Seller
Represents a seller user.
SellerMenu
Reperesents the menu for sellers with various features
SettingPrompt
Utility class for creating prompts based on the specified SettingType.
SettingsMenu
Represents a menu for modifying user profile settings, such as password, email, address, and phone number.
SettingType
Enumeration representing different types of user settings
ShoppingCart
The ShoppingCart class represents the shopping cart interface for a buyer in the online shopping system.
SolutionPrompt
The SolutionPrompt class generates a prompt for adding solutions.
Stationery
Represents a stationery product.
StringValidator
A validator for checking the validity of a string.
SubMenu
Represents a submenu that can contain various menu components.
User
 
UserCatalog
The UserCatalog class represents a catalog of users with various filtering options.
UserController
Controller class managing operations related to users.
UserList<T extends User>
Represents a list of users on the platform.
UserMenu
The UserMenu class represents a menu specific to a user, providing options such as liking or following the user.
UsernameValidator
A validator for checking the validity of a username.
UserPage
The UserPage class represents a page that displays information about a user, including details such as username, followers, liked products (for buyers), and listed products (for sellers).
UserRepository
The UserRepository class is responsible for managing and persisting user data.
UserService
Service class for handling user-related operations.
Validator
A generic interface for implementing input validation.
